individualScoreReport.scoreReports.welcome: Welcome to your ROAR Score Report
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.loading: Loading Your Individual Roar Score Report...
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.stillWorking: It looks like {firstName} is still working on completing their assigned games!
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.needOneComplete: {firstName}'s individual score report will be built when the child has completed at least one assessment.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.roarSummery: The Rapid Online Assessment of Reading (ROAR) assesses children across a range of foundational reading skills.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.summery: In this report, you will find {firstName}’s scoring at the time of testing, as well as ways you can support {firstName} in their path to reading fluency and comprehension!
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.taskIntro: The ROAR assessments return these kinds of scores:
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.standardScoreDescription: {taskTitle} is a way of showing how your child's test performance compares to other kids of the same age or grade. Standard Scores have a range of 0-180. The standard score is comparable within a grade level, but not across grade levels or over time.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.percentileScoreDescription: {taskTitle} refers to a child's rank within their grade level on the given skill. The percentile is the number of children out of 100 who have lower scores for that skill. For example, children in the 50th percentile would score higher than 50 out of 100 children in the same grade.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.rawScoreDescription: {taskTitle} is the basic measure of a child's performance on the test. Depending on the test, the raw score is based on a number of factors. These may include the number of items a child answered correctly or incorrectly, and the difficulty of the items. The raw score is comparable across grade levels and over time.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.roarDescription: {roar} assesses foundational reading skills that are ideally in place before 5th grade.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.extraSupportDescription: In Grades 6–12, skills that {supportCategory} are at or below a 3rd-grade level. Children with this support level likely need additional systematic, intensive instruction on this skill in order to access grade-level reading.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.developingDescription: Skills that are {supportCategory} are between a 3rd- and 5th-grade level. Children with this support level may need additional instruction on this skill in order to access grade-level reading.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.achievedDescription: Skills that have been {supportCategory} are above a 5th-grade level. Children who have achieved this skill likely do not require intervention on this skill to access grade-level reading.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.skillsDescription: If a reader has achieved all of these skills, it is likely that foundational reading skills are sufficient. If they are still struggling with reading comprehension, other skills such as vocabulary, syntax, or comprehension strategies may be holding them back.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.nextSteps: This score report provides a broad overview of your child's reading development. Understand that a child's progress may not be linear, and their scores are not fixed- everyone has room to grow and learn. To learn more about any given test or subskill, and to find more resources for supporting your child {link}
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.rawTaskDescription: {firstName} achieved a composite score of {rawScore} in {taskName}. {taskDescription}
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.standardTaskDescription: {firstName} scored a standard score of {standardScore}, which indicates they {supportCategory} {taskName}. {taskDescription}
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.percentileTaskDescription: {firstName} scored in the {percentile}, which indicates they {supportCategory} {taskName}. {taskDescription}
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.optionalTagText: This task was a optional assignment.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.requiredTagText: This task was a required assignment.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.reliableTagText: The child's behavior did not trigger any flags and the run can be considered reliable
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.unreliableTagText: The run was marked as unreliable.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.unreliableTagTextFlags: The run was marked unreliable because of the following flags
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.percentileGrading: Percents are scored in relation to other children in this grade level.
individualScoreReport.scoreReports.reliabilityMessage: For all scores, some caution should be exercised when interpreting scores.  {firstName}'s current behaviors during the last administration of the tests are noted below.

gameTabs.introDescription: Learn how to play our games.
gameTabs.heartsAndFlowersDescription: Match the correct side to the hearts and flowers.
gameTabs.matrixReasoningDescription: Find the missing piece to complete the puzzle.
gameTabs.memoryGameDescription: Watch the squares light up. Remember the order and make the same pattern.
gameTabs.sameDifferentSelectionDescription: Find things that are the same about the shapes.
gameTabs.theoryOfMindDescription: Listen to the stories and answer the questions.
gameTabs.trogDescription: Listen to the words and choose the matching picture.
gameTabs.surveyDescriptionChild: Answer questions about your time at school.
gameTabs.surveyDescriptionParentPart1: This survey will take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete and will ask questions about your child.
gameTabs.surveyDescriptionParentPart2: This survey will take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete and will ask questions about your home and yourself.
gameTabs.surveyDescriptionTeacherPart1: This survey will take approximately 5-10 minutes to complete and asks about your background and beliefs about teaching.
gameTabs.surveyDescriptionTeacherPart2: This survey will take approximately 5-10 minutes to complete and asks questions about the classroom(s) you teach.
gameTabs.vocabDescription: Listen to the word and choose the matching picture.
gameTabs.roarInferenceDescription: Read the stories and answer the questions.

authSignIn.signInWithEmailLinkPlaceHolder: Press Go to sign-in with an email link.
